thread.title: Odell Beckham Jr. breaks another receiving record
thread.title_full: Odell Beckham Jr. breaks another receiving record

title: Odell Beckham Jr. breaks another receiving record
text:
Odell Beckham Jr. breaks another receiving record FOX Sports 
Oct 4, 2015 at 5:37p ET + 
Odell Beckham Jr. is off to the best 16-game start by a receiver in NFL history. Kevin Hoffman / USA TODAY Sports FOX Sports Updated Oct 4, 2015 at 5:51p ET 
New York Giants wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr . made NFL history again Sunday during a Week 4 win against the Buffalo Bills. 
Playing in the 16th game of his career, Beckham finished with five catches for 38 yards -- in the process he set the new NFL record for the most receiving yards through the first 16 games of a player's career, with 1,612. true Odell Beckham Jr. now has the most receiving yards by any player in his first 16 games in NFL history #NYGvsBUF üëèüëè pic.twitter.com/1zNJNZIQRO 
Beckham was targeted 12 times, but he struggled to create much against a stingy Bills pass defense. Through four games, Beckham has 24 catches for 307 yards and two touchdowns. MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our NFL newsletters. 
He's not on the same pace as he was during his 2014 rookie season, but if you prorate his stats over the course of a full season, he would finish with 96 receptions for 1,228 yards and eight touchdowns.
